item.title: Hugo + Github Actions
item.author: Author
item.description: I’ll admit, I was having a little difficulty understanding how to organize and deploy my first hugo site. Every time I pushed changes, Github Pages wasn’t deploying the site the way I was expecting. I missed a small but critical step. In the post I referenced in my first post hello hugo, I missed the step to cd public then push. I was pushing the entire project and hoping there was some hugo magic that would work under the hood to render the site once deployed.

item.title: hello hugo
item.author: Author
item.description: “Hello World”, or should I say “Hello Hugo.” I’ve wanted to start blogging again for sometime now. What do they say? The best time to start a blog was 30 years ago, the next best time is today. … or something like that. I’m playing around with a few hugo themes tonight. Hopefully I’ll manage to at least keep the content going. My intention is to keep this content short.
